- 2 -
Off from Belen at 10:00 P.M., ve had an uneventful trip to
arrive at 6:30 A.M. at Rio.
Unfortunately, me did not get a
good
look at the unequalled harbor that morning as me came in with a low
ceiling and poor visibility.
The airport is on an islend
some 50
minutes by launch from the shore facility where passports ere examined.
Thile going through that ordeal, re met Pres Bush, Jr., who orks for
PAA in Rio, and Admirel Porell,
tho is Number One.
Then to the Copa-
cabana Palace Hotel, where the meetings of IATA rould be held.
It's
a fairly rugged trip doun to Rio, so re mere glad to have a pert of
friday, all saturday und Sunday to rest up, and on my pert to get ready
for the meetings.
We rent for a walk Friday - took an automobile trip
Seturday - another Sunday.
Dinner party Saturday night at Admiral
Powell's, end then got into a series of oris, drink, and eat meetings
which lested the week.
Our meeting of the Executive Committee ended
on Friday noon, and with it my term of office.
For your information,
the Internationel Air Transport Association
(IATA) is composed of some 65 companies of 30 countries.
The Executive
Committee of trelve is somewhat like a Board of Directors.
On it rith
me were tro other Americans end one esch British, Indian,
Ecyptian,
French, Austrelien,
Swedish, Hollander and Brazilien.
torld vere to meet et Petropolis, some forty miles north of Rio.
Debby
end I decided to drive up Friday afternoon.
Petropolis is up in the
mountains about 3,000 feet above Rio.
It was the old summer capital of
Don Pedro and during the late ver the Brazilions built a hotel there
thich is really fabulous.
It is tremendous, and looks like a huge wedding
cake.
The convention hall is larger than the dome of St. Peter's.
Saturday,
the llth, was cold and raining,
but Sunday, the 12th, 'es
beautiful.
We took off eround noon, and our pilot too us on & sight-
seeing trip around
the herbor - past Sugar Loar mountain and along that
part of Rio which lies outside the magnificent harbor where the full
stretch of the South Atlantic carries enormous swells up the beach torard
a solid row of big apartment houses which line Avenida
Atlentic, which
road separates them from the wide beach.
Thousands of Braziliens were
rupt Stopense oatePlaco, Biscotes eager over, hetded south for our
There re put down to discharge passengers for Uruguay and take on
gasoline.
of the American legation, that we rould
Mrs. Lafoon met us.
Leaving there, we flew along
the water of the wide
River La Platte,
facing which is the beautiful city of Montevideo.
Jur
pilot flew lon by the wreck of the Gernen pocket battleship Craf Spee,
which you rill remember the Germans scuttled with the British aiting
outside the harbor.
